title: Alexandar Richardson of Alpecin-Fenix mugged while on a training ride
content:
Alexandar Richardson (Alpecin-Fenix) said via social media that he was mugged on Thursday afternoon while riding in Richmond Park in southwest London.

The 31-year-old Brit said that at around 3 pm, â€œtwo motor bikes with 4 men and balaclavas started followingâ€ him as he was nearing the end of a training ride.

â€œI knew exactly they wanted to take my bike and started to think what the best thing I could do was. I turned around at east sheen roundabout and started riding full speed to the cafe about 500 metres away,â€ he wrote on Instagram. â€œThey simply rode one of the motor bikes into me at 60kph. I came off the bike and the first motor bike lost control. I held onto my bike however the second motor bike then dragged me and the bike along the floor for another 100 metres. After this they pulled out a 15 inch machete ğŸ”ª at which point I thought better and let the bike go.â€

Richardson shared a photo of a badly scraped leg and said that he gave details of the incident to the police.

â€œIâ€™m pretty cut up and bruised with a swollen hip but tomorrow is another day,â€ he wrote. â€œPlease be careful in the area and note this is becoming a common occurrence in parts of London. The police have taken their notes down as armed robbery and hopefully the criminals are found.â€
